intro: Orthosia tarmensis, commonly known as the Tarmian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Orthosia tarmensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
